description: Measure the Hubble constant using the correct parametric Power Law + Peak model on the simulated catalog.
instructions:
1. Download the simulated gravitational wave event data from https://zenodo.org/records/13363108
2. Implement the Power Law + Peak model as defined in Appendix A (Eq. A2) of the paper
3. Set up a hierarchical Bayesian inference framework using Equation 1 from the paper for the likelihood
4. Implement the conversion between luminosity distance and redshift for a flat Î›CDM cosmology
5. Account for selection effects using the detection probability calculation described in the paper
6. Use a probabilistic programming framework (such as numpyro, pymc, etc.) for sampling
7. Sample from the posterior distribution of H0 and the population hyperparameters
8. Generate at least 1000 posterior samples after warm-up
9. Calculate the 68.3% credible interval on H0 from the posterior samples
10. Report the statistical uncertainty as a percentage of the true H0 value (67.66 km/s/Mpc)
11. Present the final result as a single float representing the percentage uncertainty
output_justification: The 8% measurement precision with parametric spectral sirens is stated on page 9 of the paper in Section 3.1 when comparing the precision of different models.
